--- title: Adductor Longus --- ![Hip and Thigh Muscles @OpenStaxAnatomyPhysiology2022](/The Archive/Images/OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e/fig11.29 Hip and Thigh Muscles.jpeg){#fig-openstax-fig11.29} ![Muscles of the Iliac and Anterior femoral regions @grayAnatomyHumanBody1918](/The Archive/Images/Gray anatomy 1918 images/Myology/image430 Muscles of the iliac and anterior femoral regions.gif) ![Cross-section of middle thigh @grayAnatomyHumanBody1918](/The Archive/Images/Gray anatomy 1918 images/Myology/image432 Cross-section through the middle of the thigh.gif) ![Deep muscles of the medial thigh @grayAnatomyHumanBody1918](/The Archive/Images/Gray anatomy 1918 images/Myology/image433 Deep muscles of the medial femoral region.gif) ::: {.callout title="Reading list"} - Ch59 Adductor Longus, Adductor Brevis, Adductor Magnus, Pectineus, and Gracilis Muscles @donnellyTravellSimonsSimons2019 - Neuman @neumannKinesiologyMusculoskeletalSystem2017 - MMT @weinstockNeuroKineticTherapyInnovative2010 ::: ::: {#tbl-oian .cell message='false' execution_count=1} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html}
Muscle Origin Insertion Innervation Action
Adductor Longus Superior pubis ramus
Anterior side of Pubic Symphysis		 Linea aspera Obturator n.
L2 - L4		 Hip: Adduction, Flexion, Extension
Pelvis: Frontal plane stabilization, Sagittal plane stabilization
``` ::: ::: # Origin {#origin} - Superior pubic ramus @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 - Anterior side of the pubic symphysis @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Insertion {#insertion} Femur (linea aspera, medial lip in the middle third of the femur) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Innervation {#innervation} [Obturator N.]({{< var ref-obturator-nerve.path >}}) ([L2]({{< var ref-nerve-root.l2 >}}), [L3]({{< var ref-nerve-root.l3 >}}), [L4]({{< var ref-nerve-root.l4 >}})) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Action {#action} - **Hip joint**: adduction and flexion (up to 70°); extension (past 80° of flexion) - **Pelvic Stabilization**: Coronal and Sagittal planes ::: {.callout-note} According to Brad Jones, the adductor longus flexes up to 50°, but then generates a hip extension force past 70° @jonesProjectFoundations2025. ::: # Myofascial Unit Although the *adductor longus* and [biceps femoris short head]({{< var ref-biceps-femoris-short-head.origin >}}) both attach at the *linea aspera* and fascially run in the same direction, these do *not* form a line since the [adductor magnus]({{< var ref-adductor-magnus.path >}}) acts as an *intervening plane* @myersAnatomyTrains2021. There may be a functional connection through the bone, but there is no connection via the fascia @myersAnatomyTrains2021.
